page.title: 04Hartside Communtiy Assoc.
page.content: The community association was formed as the Hartside school building was being completed and the school building was always intended to be used for the dual purpose of Education and recreation. During the day there are facilities for the elderly to meet and perhaps have some small refreshments whilst during the evening the courses offered are very varied.These include Bridge, Chess, Badminton, Bowls, German, French, Dancing for all ages at differing times,Keep Fit,a mother and toddler group, Art classes and a group for Self-defence. The centre is run by three paid wardens each working 9 hours a week abd relies on many volunteer helpers. They draw from all over the Crook area the large numbers of people who attend.
